column6: Steps (Instructions)
column7: Steps (Expected Result)
column8: Preconditions/Validadtion

column6: 1.Enter the text "Hello, World!" into the editor.
column7: The text "Hello, World!" is displayed in the editor without any formatting.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open

column6:
1.Select the text.
2.Click the "Bold" button and observe.
3.Click the "Italic" button and observe.
4.Click the "Underline" button and observe.
column7: The selected text appears bold, italicized, and underlined.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open, and some text is entered.

column6:
1.Select all text.
2.Click each alignment option (Left, Center, Right, Justify) and observe each time.
column7: The text aligns as per the selected alignment option.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open with multiple lines of text.

column6:
1.Select the text.
2.Change the font to "Arial" and size to "16pt."
column7: The selected text changes to Arial font with a size of 16pt.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open with some text entered.

column6:
1.Enter a few lines of text.
2.Select the lines and click the "Bullet list" button.
3.Click the "Numbered list" button for another set of lines
column7: Text appears as a bulleted list and a numbered list respectively.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open.

column6:
1.Select the text.
2.Click the "Insert Link" button and enter a valid URL (e.g., https://example.com).
column7: The selected text becomes a clickable hyperlink redirecting to https://example.com.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open with some text.

column6:
1.Click the "Insert Image" button.
2.Select a valid image file.
column7: The selected image appears in the editor and can be resized or aligned.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open.

column6:
1.Select the text.
2.Click the "Insert Link" button and enter an invalid URL (e.g., invalid_url).
column7: An error message is displayed, or the link is not created.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open with some text

column6:
1. Attempt to open and edit an existing template.1.Click the "Insert Image" button.
2.Select an unsupported file type (e.g., .exe).
column7: The editor shows an error, preventing the image upload.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open.

column6:
1.Click the "Insert Image" button.
2.Select an oversized image file (e.g., 50 MB).
column7: The editor displays an error or compresses the image if supported.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open.

column6: 1.Attempt to submit content without entering any text or media.
column7: The system handles the submission without error or prompts the user to add content.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open.

column6: 1.Enter a very long word (e.g., 200 characters without spaces).
column7: The editor handles the text without breaking layout; text is wrapped or scrollable if necessary.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open.

column6:
1.Select the text.
2.Apply multiple formatting options (bold, italic, underline, color, alignment).
column7: The text reflects all selected formatting without conflicts.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open

column6:
1.Copy text from Word or Google Docs with various formatting.
2.Paste it into the editor.
column7: The pasted content retains formatting as closely as possible to the original.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open.

column6: 1.Enter special characters (e.g., ©, %,&,*) into the editor.
column7: The special characters and emojis display correctly without breaking the editor.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open

column6:
1.Enter basic HTML code, such as

Hello, World!

. 2.Switch back to WYSIWYG view to check if the text renders correctly.
column7: "Hello, World!" displays in the WYSIWYG view as regular text.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open

column6: 1.Enter HTML tags for formatting, such as Bold, Italic, and Underline. 2.Switch to WYSIWYG view.
column7: The text appears with bold, italic, and underline formatting as specified in the HTML.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6: 1.Enter an HTML anchor tag: Example Link. 2.Switch back to WYSIWYG view.
column7: “Example Link” appears as a clickable hyperlink, opening https://example.com when clicked.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6: 1.Enter an HTML tag with a valid image URL: . 2.Switch to WYSIWYG view.
column7: The image is displayed in the editor with the specified source and alt text
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6:
1.Enter properly nested HTML tags, such as

Nested Text

. 2.Switch back to WYSIWYG view.
column7: "Nested Text" appears with the correct formatting and hierarchy as per the HTML structure.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6: 1.Enter incorrectly structured HTML, such as Incorrect HTML. 2.Switch to WYSIWYG view and observe the result.
column7: The editor ignores or removes the invalid tag, displaying only the text "Invalid Tag."
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6: 1.Enter an image tag with an invalid URL, e.g., . 2.Switch to WYSIWYG view.
column7: The system prevents editing and does not allow automatic saving, displaying a permission error message.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6:
1.Enter an <embed> tag with an unsupported file type, such as <embed src="file.exe">.
2.Switch to WYSIWYG view.
column7: The editor ignores the tag or displays an error indicating the file type is unsupported.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6:
1.Paste a large amount of HTML content (e.g., 10,000+ characters).
2.Switch to WYSIWYG view.
column7: The editor handles the large content smoothly without lag or crash.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6:
1.Add an HTML element with an inline style using incorrect syntax:

Styled Text

. 2.Switch to WYSIWYG view.
column7: The editor ignores the invalid style, but the text "Styled Text" remains visible.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column1: Concurrent Editing in Code and WYSIWYG Views
column6:
1.Make changes to the HTML in code view.
2.Quickly switch to WYSIWYG view, then back to code view.
column7: The changes remain consistent between views, and no data is lost.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.

column6:
1.Enter an element with an invalid inline event handler: <button onclick="invalidFunction()">Click Me</button>.
2.Switch to WYSIWYG view and click the button.
column7: The button displays in the WYSIWYG view, but the invalid function does not execute or cause errors.
column8: WYSIWYG editor is open in code view.
